intro: Isolepis compressa, commonly known as narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
